alert.note: Alert for Harlan; Knott; Letcher; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 2:41PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Harlan, Letcher, southeastern Perry and southeastern Knott Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 241 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Defeated Creek, or 9 miles southwest of Whitesburg, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Flint, Kings Creek, Elko, Partridge, Maggard, Lewis Creek and Arminta around 245 PM EDT. Letcher, Blackey, Oscaloosa, Premium, Hot Spot, Roxana, Indian Bottom, David, Carcassonne and Gander around 250 PM EDT. Trailer, Whitco, Ice, Van, Dongola, Day, Jeremiah, Isom, Oven Fork and Carbon Glow around 255 PM EDT. Whitesburg, Bath, Bellcraft, Crown, Marlowe, Ermine, Colly, Tillie and Sackett around 300 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Farraday, Southdown, Winters, Millstone, Sergent, Lucastown, Thornton, Mayking, Lester, Polly, Craftsville, Chip, Seco, Neon Junction, Whitaker, Tolliver Town, Wright, Deane, Democrat, Ivan and Fleming-Neon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southeastern Kentucky.
